testcase.name: StatusesController behaves like api_controller rescues from ActiveRecord::RecordNotFound on GET #show should eq 404
StatusesController behaves like api_controller rescues from ActiveRecord::RecordNotFound on GET #show should be blank
StatusesController behaves like api_controller rescues from ActiveRecord::RecordNotFound on PUT #update should eq 404
StatusesController behaves like api_controller rescues from ActiveRecord::RecordNotFound on PUT #update should be blank
StatusesController behaves like api_controller rescues from ActiveRecord::RecordNotFound on DELETE #destroy should eq 404
StatusesController behaves like api_controller rescues from ActiveRecord::RecordNotFound on DELETE #destroy should be blank
StatusesController behaves like api_controller rescues from ActionController::ParameterMissing on POST #create should eq 422
StatusesController behaves like api_controller rescues from ActionController::ParameterMissing on POST #create should match /error/
StatusesController behaves like authenticated_api_controller authentication returns unauthorized request without email and token
StatusesController behaves like authenticated_api_controller authentication returns unauthorized request without token
StatusesController GET #index should assign all statuses as @statuses
StatusesController GET #show should assaign the requested status to @status
StatusesController POST #create with valid params should create a new Status
StatusesController POST #create with valid params should assign a newly created status as @status
StatusesController PUT #update with valid params updates the requested status
StatusesController PUT #update with valid params assigns the requested status as @status
StatusesController POST #create with invalid params assigns a newly created but unsaved status as @status
StatusesController POST #create with invalid params returns unprocessable_entity status
StatusesController PUT #update with invalid params assigns the status as @status
StatusesController PUT #update with invalid params returns unprocessable_entity status
StatusesController DELETE #destroy destroys the requested status
StatusesController DELETE #destroy redirects to the statuses list
